intro: Pseudocarapa yunzaingensis, commonly known as the Yunzaingensis Carapa, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, specifically found in regions of Myanmar. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits containing seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its genus.
